title: Build the RICHUAL marketing website with application-based membership form

requirements.text: Create a multi-page RICHUAL marketing website with the following top-level pages and navigation: Home, About RICHUAL, Programs, Membership, Ritual Philosophy, and Apply.

quotes: Implement required site pages: Home, About, Programs (Initiate/Warrior/Titan/Inner Circle), Membership, Ritual Philosophy, Apply

acceptanceCriteria: A persistent header navigation provides links to Home, About, Programs, Membership, Ritual Philosophy, and Apply.
Each navigation item routes to a distinct page view.
All pages render without runtime errors and are usable on mobile and desktop screen sizes.

requirements.text: Apply a consistent RICHUAL visual theme across the entire site: matte black base, metallic gold primary accents, deep saffron highlight accents; bold uppercase headings; clean modern body typography; high-contrast, minimal, premium layout; overall tone should feel elite, intense, and ritualistic (not casual or commercial).

quotes: Color Palette: Matte Black, Gold, Deep Saffron accents

acceptanceCriteria: All pages share a consistent color palette (matte black background, gold accents, saffron highlights).
Headings are visually distinct, bold, and uppercase; body text is clean and readable with strong contrast.
The UI avoids playful/casual styling and maintains a minimal, premium look site-wide.

requirements.text: Create an Apply page with a form containing the following fields: Name, Age, Current fitness level, Income goal, and Why do you want to join?; include a submit button labeled "Begin Your Transformation."

quotes: üì≤ Join / Apply Page Form fields: Name Age Current fitness level Income goal Why do you want to join? CTA: ‚ÄúBegin Your Transformation.‚Äù

acceptanceCriteria: Apply page renders a form with inputs for Name, Age, Current fitness level, Income goal, and a longer text field for motivation.
Submit button label is exactly "Begin Your Transformation."
Form validates required fields on the client and shows clear inline or on-submit error messages in English.

requirements.text: Persist Apply form submissions in the backend and expose backend methods to (a) create a new application and (b) list applications for administrative review.

quotes: Build Apply/Join page form ... with submission handling

acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores submitted applications durably (survive canister restart).
There is a backend method to create an application record from the Apply form data.
There is a backend method to list stored application records for later review.
All backend methods have stable, documented types matching the form fields (Name, Age, Current fitness level, Income goal, Motivation, plus a server-generated timestamp and unique id).

requirements.text: Wire the Apply form submission UI to call the backend create-application method; show a success confirmation state after submission and prevent duplicate submissions from the same UI interaction (e.g., disable the button while submitting).

quotes: Build Apply/Join page form ... with submission handling

acceptanceCriteria: Submitting the Apply form calls the backend and creates a stored application record.
While submitting, the submit button is disabled and a loading state is shown.
On success, the user sees a clear English confirmation message and the form resets or transitions to a confirmation view.
On failure, the user sees a clear English error message and can retry.

requirements.text: Add a minimal admin-only review page (not linked from the public navigation) that displays the list of submitted applications (most recent first). Protect access using Internet Identity login and restrict viewing to a hardcoded allowlist of admin principals configured in the backend.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin review page is not accessible from the public header navigation.
Viewing the admin review page requires Internet Identity login.
Only principals in an admin allowlist can view the applications list; non-admin authenticated users see an access denied message.
The admin page lists applications with at least: timestamp, name, age, fitness level, income goal, and motivation.

requirements.text: Generate and apply a coherent visual art direction as static assets: smoke/embers texture, subtle temple/stone texture background, and a simple RICHUAL emblem mark; use them across the site as backgrounds/accents while maintaining readability and high contrast.

quotes: Background: intense gym visuals + subtle Shiva-inspired energy
Background: Smoke Fire sparks Temple architecture textures

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are saved as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend (not served via the backend).
At least one texture/background asset is visible on the Home hero and does not reduce text contrast below readable levels.
A simple emblem/mark is visible in the header and/or footer and matches the dark luxury theme.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing UI text in the application.
Backend must follow the single-actor architecture (all Motoko logic in one main actor).
Do not edit any files under the frontend immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose existing UI components instead.
nonGoals: Do not implement payments, subscriptions, or checkout flows at this stage.
Do not implement real-time features (notifications, chat, websockets).
Do not integrate third-party authentication providers other than Internet Identity.
Do not promise or configure a custom domain name within this build request.
